qas.question: What can clothing provide during hazardous activities?
What type of surfaces can clothing protect from?
What does clothing keep toxic materials away from?
What can insulate against cold or hot conditions?
What type of radiation can clothing provide some protection from?
Clothing cannot protect you from what kind of activities
What can protect you from smooth surfaces
What offers protection for many kinds of radiation?
What helps keep you warm in hot conditions?

context: Physically, <b6_0>clothing<b6_0/> serves many purposes: it can serve as protection from the elements, and can enhance <a0_0>safety<a0_0/> during <b5_0>hazardous<b5_0/> activities such as hiking and cooking. It protects the wearer from <a1_0>rough<a1_0/> surfaces, rash-causing plants, insect bites, splinters, thorns and prickles by providing a barrier between the skin and the environment. <a3_0><b7_0><b9_0>Clothes<b9_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/> can insulate against cold or hot conditions. Further, they can provide a hygienic barrier, keeping infectious and toxic materials away from the <a2_0>body<a2_0/>. <b8_0>Clothing<b8_0/> also provides protection from harmful <a4_0>UV<a4_0/> radiation.
